card.title: "Countdown To Looking Glass" (1984) Cold-War USSR Nuclear Attack Film

_source.content: "Countdown To Looking Glass" (1984) Cold-War USSR Nuclear Attack Film Docudrama uses fictional reports of a crisis in the Middle East, which leads to a nuclear confrontation between the US and the USSR.  The story is told through a live news report that follows the apocalyptic world-ending nuclear exchange.  An excellent, dramatic doomsday scenario in which the Cold War fully escalates. "Looking Glass" is the code word for the Strategic Air Command's control plane which is to be used in the case of nuclear war.A Canadian made-for-television movie, and the narrative of the film details the events that lead up to the initial exchange of nuclear weapons, which was triggered by a banking crisis, from the perspective of an ongoing news broadcast.The nuclear powered aircraft carrier U.S.S. Nimitz portrayed in this movie is actually the museum ship U.S.S. Yorktown (ex CV 10) moored in Charleston Harbor, Charleston, South Carolina.  Starring Scott Glenn, Michael Murphy, Helen Shaver as Dorian Waldorf, Eric Sevareid (as himself) and a young Newt Gingrich (as himself).First aired on October 14, 1984.  For education, entertainment, enlightenment and inspiration. https://youtu.be/GQzgHBjQzf4
_source.contentraw:
"Countdown To Looking Glass" (1984) Cold-War USSR Nuclear Attack Film

Docudrama uses fictional reports of a crisis in the Middle East, which leads to a nuclear confrontation between the US and the USSR. The story is told through a live news report that follows the apocalyptic world-ending nuclear exchange. An excellent, dramatic doomsday scenario in which the Cold War fully escalates. "Looking Glass" is the code word for the Strategic Air Command's control plane which is to be used in the case of nuclear war.

A Canadian made-for-television movie, and the narrative of the film details the events that lead up to the initial exchange of nuclear weapons, which was triggered by a banking crisis, from the perspective of an ongoing news broadcast.

The nuclear powered aircraft carrier U.S.S. Nimitz portrayed in this movie is actually the museum ship U.S.S. Yorktown (ex CV 10) moored in Charleston Harbor, Charleston, South Carolina. Starring Scott Glenn, Michael Murphy, Helen Shaver as Dorian Waldorf, Eric Sevareid (as himself) and a young Newt Gingrich (as himself).

First aired on October 14, 1984. For education, entertainment, enlightenment and inspiration.
https://youtu.be/GQzgHBjQzf4

card.title: Mayor Adams admits Bronx migrant tent camp may violate NYC right-to-shelter rules

_source.content: Mayor Adams admits Bronx migrant tent camp may violate NYC right-to-shelter rulesNY Daily News via Yahoo ^ | 9/27/22 | Michael Gartland, Chris Sommerfeldthttps://www.yahoo.com/video/mayor-adams-admits-bronx-migrant-202700562.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly9kdWNrZHVja2dvLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAACAocylDJ0tdHEnjvEcZ0HWsg39Jp7-8i-gepz5XFmBYxjUrdmJJKhL2jWhbgLBzDI4C_46Mk3bd6Kk8julbZKoEDHp9YrFpFSMayor Adams acknowledged Tuesday that his administration’s controversial migrant tent camp in the Bronx may violate local right-to-shelter rules that have tripped him up several times this summer as the city struggles to accommodate waves of Latin American asylum seekers.The decadesold right-to-shelter law requires the city to provide a bed to anyone who needs one, and also stipulates certain benchmark amenities, such as a set amount of space between beds and access to lockers, laundry and mail services. Amid an enormous influx of migrants in recent months, Adams has repeatedly said his administration must “reassess” the law, though he hasn’t specified how or which aspects of it he’d target for reform.During a press conference in Manhattan Tuesday morning, Adams shed some light on the matter as he said for the first time that he does not believe right-to-shelter rules should apply to the tent facility that the city is erecting in the Orchard Beach parking lot to house hundreds of migrants.“The migrant crisis is outside of the housing initiative that we are doing for right-to-shelter,” Adams told reporters when asked if the Orchard Beach site will comply with right-to-shelter protocols. “These are two different entities. We are dealing with a humanitarian crisis that was created by human hands.”Earlier in the news conference, he said, “This is not a shelter issue. This is a humanitarian, refugee, migrant crisis.”By differentiating between homelessness and migration, Adams could be staking out a legal framework for why the city should be able to skirt the right-to-shelter law when it comes to housing the thousands of migrants who have arrived in the city in recent months after crossing into the U.S. from Mexico in hopes of seeking asylum.New York City Mayor Eric Adamshttps://gab.com/Agitators/posts/107586971331472748Contact:http://ericadams2021.comhttps://www.facebook.com/80559174013https://www.instagram.com/ericadamsfornycPeople in PoliticsPage 1 https://gab.com/Agitators/posts/108487037613807087
_source.contentraw:
Mayor Adams admits Bronx migrant tent camp may violate NYC right-to-shelter rules
NY Daily News via Yahoo ^ | 9/27/22 | Michael Gartland, Chris Sommerfeldt
https://www.yahoo.com/video/mayor-adams-admits-bronx-migrant-202700562.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly9kdWNrZHVja2dvLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAACAocylDJ0tdHEnjvEcZ0HWsg39Jp7-8i-gepz5XFmBYxjUrdmJJKhL2jWhbgLBzDI4C_46Mk3bd6Kk8julbZKoEDHp9YrFpFS

Mayor Adams acknowledged Tuesday that his administration’s controversial migrant tent camp in the Bronx may violate local right-to-shelter rules that have tripped him up several times this summer as the city struggles to accommodate waves of Latin American asylum seekers.

The decadesold right-to-shelter law requires the city to provide a bed to anyone who needs one, and also stipulates certain benchmark amenities, such as a set amount of space between beds and access to lockers, laundry and mail services. Amid an enormous influx of migrants in recent months, Adams has repeatedly said his administration must “reassess” the law, though he hasn’t specified how or which aspects of it he’d target for reform.

During a press conference in Manhattan Tuesday morning, Adams shed some light on the matter as he said for the first time that he does not believe right-to-shelter rules should apply to the tent facility that the city is erecting in the Orchard Beach parking lot to house hundreds of migrants.

“The migrant crisis is outside of the housing initiative that we are doing for right-to-shelter,” Adams told reporters when asked if the Orchard Beach site will comply with right-to-shelter protocols. “These are two different entities. We are dealing with a humanitarian crisis that was created by human hands.”

Earlier in the news conference, he said, “This is not a shelter issue. This is a humanitarian, refugee, migrant crisis.”

By differentiating between homelessness and migration, Adams could be staking out a legal framework for why the city should be able to skirt the right-to-shelter law when it comes to housing the thousands of migrants who have arrived in the city in recent months after crossing into the U.S. from Mexico in hopes of seeking asylum.

New York City Mayor Eric Adams

association meeting in Washington.

'expedite the development' of a coronavirus vaccine.

the spread of coronavirus.
Feb 18 HHS announced it would engage with Sanofi Pasteur in an effort to quickly develop a coronavirus vaccine
and to develop treatment for coronavirus infections.
Feb 22 A W.H.O. team of international experts arrives in Wuhan China...finally.
Feb 24 The Trump administration sent a letter to congress requesting at least 2.5 billion dollars to help combat the
spread of the coronavirus.
Feb 24 pelosi took a tour through Chinatown on February 24, where she decried alleged racism that was occurring against
Asian Americans as a result of the virus, which originated in the Chinese province of Wuhan.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eFCzoXhNM6c&feature=emb_logo
Feb 26 President Trump discussed coronavirus containment with Indian PM Modi and updated the press on his
administration's containment efforts in the U.S. during his visit to India.
Feb 29 The Trump administration Announced a level 4 travel advisory to areas of Italy and South Korea.
Barred all travel to Iran.
Barred the entry of foreign citizens who visted Iran in the last 14 days.
Feb 26 New York Times headline: Let's call it the Trumpvirus. If you're feeling awful, you know who to blame.
Feb 29 Dr Fauci in an interview said we need not change the way we are living until we say community spread.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PRa6t_e7dgI
March 9 Dr Fauci in a Forbes interview said cruising is okay if you are healthy.

Good morning❗ ☕

✝️ 📜🌄 Daily Bible verse
For narrow is the door and hard the road to life, and only a small number make discovery of it.
Matthew 7:14

🌄 Morning prayer
Lord, give us the discernment to discover the right path and the courage and wisdom to follow it. *
🙏 In Jesus' name we pray. Amen.

🌄 There will always be another hill to climb, another wonder to discover. Life is exciting for the adventurous
Let's all make the day count.*

*Charlie Daniels

📣 It's Wednesday, September 28, 2022, and the Obama/Biden administration was/(is) the most corrupt in US history. #Obamagate.
- Dan Bongino

⏱💣 1 Year and 251 Days of a "hostage situation." -Juanita Broaddrick

🇺🇸🖋️Biden Executive actions: 578 as of September 26, 2022, including 99 executive orders, 102 presidential memoranda, 316 proclamations, and 61 notices. (Ballotpedia)
The Biden Recession is here. Unemployment rate ticked up to 3.7%. Although the labor force participation rate rose to 62.4% in August, 50% of employers anticipate job cuts in the next six months.
Feds have raised the interest rate 5 times this year, .75 percentage points for the 3rd straight time. Mortgage interest rates are over 6%. Inflation is 8.3%.

Gas is $3.77/gallon.⬆️ (AAA) It's ALREADY going back up.

RCP averages: Joe's job approval rating spread is -10.5%.
His job approval avg: 42.9%. (Reuters says 39%, -18 spread.)

Build The Wall
DC mayor Bowser is upset that her city shelters are being "overrun" with illegal aliens. At least 3 buses of illegals were unloaded in front of Kamala's Naval Observatory residence. Don't let up now, Gov. Abbott ❗
Eric Adams has opened 14 luxury hotels in NYC free to the illegals. TX Gov Abbott has now added Chicago to the destination list for illegals. Mayor Lightfoot is immediately busing them out to the suburbs.
Ron DeSantis sent 2 planes of illegals to Martha's Vineyard and the dems went berserk. 125 National Guard were immediately deployed to escort the 50 illegals out of the snobby neighborhood that says they welcome ALL.
Next stop: Joe's place in Wilmington, DE, or Rehobeth Beach ❓ DeSantis makes light of any lawsuits or investigations targeting him. I say, sue the Big Guy in the OO❗ Nearly 5 MILLION illegals have skipped across Joe's border already.

On Covid
Ahead of the election, the CDC relaxes its stance on Covid -19 ❗ The 🐘 in the room: "Young, healthy people are dying in large numbers by collapsing". No, the NIH still does NOT advise using ivermectin to treat Covid-19 except in clinical trials. The NIH is years behind the data and efficacy, and thousands have died because of it.
➡️ The UK starts paying out big bucks for injuries and deaths caused by the experimental Covid jab.⬅️

Law and Order
Why are Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell the only 2 people convicted of child sex trafficking? There is a l o n g list.

Current events.
Joe has spent 1.5 trillion dollars for 99 executive orders ❗ As congress controls the purse strings, t h a t should be challenged NOW.
Biden gave his "RED" speech on the "soul of the nation" at Independence Hall, Philadelphia, calling out MAGA as radicals.
The January 6 political prisoners are s t i l l locked up with no charges, unlike the lib that purposely ran over an 18 yr. old Trump supporter and killed him with his truck.
The FBI seized Mike Lindell's phone in Minnesota. Unconstitutional ❗
Election Rigging- through FOIA requests, we now know that Bill Barr never investigated any of the rigged election claims, even though he told Trump and Americans that he did, and he stated it in his book. Who is he reporting to? 🙄
Bill Barr, tell us who made the call to shut down the ballot counting in 6 states?

Kevin McCarthy announced the GOP's Commitment to America ahead of the mid-terms. First up: Fire 87,000 IRS agents.👍

WHO is the SCOTUS leaker❓
SCOTUS begins hearing cases for the 2022-23 term Oct. 3.

China announced more drills after the second bunch of dem politicians flew to Taiwan. Billions more US dollars sent to Ukraine.

Even though Liz Cheney lost her congressional seat, she's back on the Jan 6 witch hunt committee stirring up her cauldron❗ 🐈‍⬛

⛴️ ⛓️
Food shortages and supply chain issues abound. Here's a solution- Fire Mayor Pete❗

POTUS 45
Trump's endorsed candidates have pretty much swept the primaries nationwide.
Merrick Garland (DOJ) authorized the FBI RAID on Mar-A-Lago with the knowledge (and goading) of Joe Biden. 🙄
Raymond Dearie has been appointed special master. He does NOT want to see the documents in question. WHAT?
Trump campaigned for NC Senate candidate Ted Budd to another overflowing crowd ❗

Durham Report
Can there be justice in DC?

September 28, 1542, Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo landed near San Diego, and "discovered" California❗ ❗
